name: PastaMania - Italian Casual Dining @ Tampines Mall

reviews.text:
PastaMania at Tampines Mall offers a casual Italian dining experience. It's a convenient spot for a quick and affordable meal while shopping. The menu features a variety of pasta dishes, from classic Carbonara and Bolognese to local-inspired options like Seafood Tom Yum. You can also find pizzas and some sides.
While some reviews mention the food can be average and the sauces might taste commercially prepared, others appreciate the quick service and reasonable prices, especially for families. It's a halal-certified restaurant, making it accessible to a wider group. The ambiance is generally comfortable for a casual meal. If you're looking for a no-fuss Italian meal in Tampines Mall, PastaMania is a decent option.

Few points to highlight,
-Would appreciate no sweeping of floor before closing when diners are eating
-To remember about promotion mechanisms

Two people ordered:
Cheesy graclic bread: Was just okay
Truffle Mac and cheese baked pasta: It was not baked and was way too salty and watery.
Chicken sausage spaghetti: No salt at all (as per the personnel, no salt is added in pasta) so do it yourself.
What kind of service is this?
1 guy running up and down. Nice guy but lack of manpower.
$14.20 for truffle pasta that had no taste nor scent of truffle is simply overpriced. They should have named the dish ‚ÄúGarlic mushroom with tasteless cream pasta‚Äù. üò≠
I have to eat without cutleries... staff talking very loud.... one of the staff wear a mask without covering his nose or mouth... food standard dropped... pasta no taste... sauce very thick...

Food was good and it was served within 10 minutes. Their Aligo Olio linguine was well cooked and the cheese stick was hot and crispy. Overall good experience and this restaurant is family friendly since they have a long table that can cater for big groups.
